Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great room, great staff”
Reviews.Author: FranconianTraveler
Reviews.Content: Thank you for a perfect stay during a crazy st. Patrick's Day weekend !

Reviews.Title: “A very disappointed Diamond Member”
Reviews.Author: rvanderzande
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a lot of Hilton hotels including HGI across the country, but I have never had this kind of experience before. We checked in late on January 6th 2012 in the HGI and my room key could not be prepared, because the system was down. We were tired and just wanted to go to sleep, but had to wait about 45 minutes. When we checked into our room the room was a smoking room. When we officially complaint about it, we were asked to leave the hotel. Thank god there was another Hilton-Conrad right next door that was able to accommodate us. Needless to say, we will never stay at this HGI again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: dandydon520
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, Staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a small issue with our room door. They made every attempt to get us back into our room ASAP. They offered us complimentary drinks in the hotel bar while we waited for the maintance man. They took excellent care of us. Great loacation and very clean and professionally run.

Reviews.Title: “Such a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AddiesGrammy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There is a lot do right around the hotel and the subway to get all around Chicago is just steps away from the door. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Myra_11
Reviews.Content: The Hilton was a very convenient location in downtown Chicago, minutes from the Magnificent Mile and just steps from the subway! The hotel was clean and modern. Fresh homemade cookies available at the front desk every day after 5pm to welcome you home, front desk personnel were very helpful with suggestions on where to go for dinner and sightseeing. Because we were in Chicago in late February the rates with AAA were the best but this was offset by the high charge for overnight parking(downtown rates are all high), If you plan to use the public transportation buy a one - three day pass as this will really save you time and money, We traveled to Oak Park in 30 minutes for $2.25 whereas a taxi ride would cost you$25.00. No breakfast of course is included bu there are plenty of breakfast places or the standby Starbucks on every other corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amenities, service”
Reviews.Author: Drew C
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Great location, friendly and helpful staff, and a terrific value for a downtown Chicago hotel. Room: larger than average size for a downtown hotel. I've stayed in other downtown hotels costing 2-3x more than the Hilton Garden Inn and the rooms were half the size. Everything was well made, arranged, and very clean. I'm a Hilton HHonors Gold member, so I was upgraded to a nice king room on the 23rd (top) floor. No complaints. Check-in/front desk/staff: check-in was fast and easy. Staff was very helpful and friendly, both in person and over the phone. Location: can't beat it. Located on Grand between Wabash and State, just 2 blocks from Michigan Avenue and the Mag Mile. Weber Grill restaurant is in the hotel and serves breakfast. There is a Jewel-Osco grocery store across the street. The CTA Red Line subway station at Grand is just steps away from the main entrance of the hotel, very convenient. Parking: pricy but no different than any other hotel. $49/day for self-parking but if you want a cheaper parking option just use the parking garage across the street at the Grand Plaza ($34). Rate: very reasonable for the location. Hilton offers reasonable AAA and government discounts. Definitely would stay here again. No issues or problems and you can't beat the location, it's in the middle of the Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend stay :-)”
Reviews.Author: ConnieR60993
Reviews.Content: My teenager and I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn downtown Chicago for a couple of days while she was doing college visit/tours. It was perfect: 1) great room value (but wow the $49/night parking price!!) 2) good size comfortable room (we didn't find the adjustable beds super comfortable, but they were fun). 3) very friendly staff, especially front desk (thank you for the Grand Lux recommendation) 4) absolutely perfect location - we walked to the Art Institute, Water Tower Place shopping, the Oriental Theater, etc. - all very close by. Also, here's a shout -out to the housekeeping staff - THANK YOU for finding and sending our camera!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: thefarmingtonhill
Reviews.Content: Reserved this hotel with an awesome AAA rate. Good, central location two blocks from Michigan Ave. Our (early) check in was fast, and everyone has been super friendly. The pool is small, but pool area is nice and the hot tub is HOT! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: itnorluv
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Inn is located at the corner of State Street and East Grand Avenue in downtown Chicago right at the red-line metro stop. The room on the 16th floor was spacious and clean with adequate toiletries and comfort. There was a mini-fridge and microwave as well as large flat-screen TV with plenty of channels. The staff were very friendly with easy check-in and check-out. Unfortunately, the hotel was extremely noisy. There was a large amount of hallway noise all night long as well as lots of street noise transmitted through the windows. The gym was small but clean and had the basic amenities. An indoor pool is also onsite. There is a Starbucks in the lobby and a Weber grill within the hotel. The meeting facilities and complementary business lounge are clean and provide the needed amenities. Free wifi throughout the hotel is a definite plus.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay--no bells and whistles, but good just the same”
Reviews.Author: 2dads2kids
Reviews.Content: I like Hilton chains and did not want to pay a fortune for a two-night stay in the city. This Hilton Garden Inn was a great find. My room was large, clean, quiet, and very clean bathroom. All of this for a GREAT price. There is nothing flashy with this hotel, so the gem of the stay is the actual price and room. Bonuses, however, include the fact that the red line is RIGHT NEXT to the main hotel entrance. There is also a Trader Joe one block away for those of us who like some access to decent food items. Everything else was within walking distance, including Michigan Ave. I would definitely stay here again if the price were to be as competitive as the one I got for this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Business friendly enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: rszAtlanta_Ga
Reviews.Content: The Garden Inn is in a good location with lots of options for eating and entertainment. The hotel lobby is a little small but well laid out. They do not have their own restaurant but are attached to Webbers and I found that the food here to be very good. Rooms are well furnished with all the amenities that you expect at this level of Hilton property. The staff at the hotel was very helpful and pleasant from the front desk to the cleaning personnel. The only drawback was the elevators that during the morning rush were a bit slow and crowded. I did not have a car but learned from others that parking is expensive with the hotel but there is a private lot across the street that is far more reasonable and the walk is minimal. Breakfast for Honor members is at Webbers and it was very good. Eggs done well. Staff was very friendly. I will stay here again either for business or a weekend getaway as I like the smaller venue and the free breakfast and that is not the case at many of the "luxury" hotels in the downtown area. This is a very good Garden Inn that is a reasonably priced choice for trips to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice escape to the City!”
Reviews.Author: traveler429
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend getaway from the suburbs. The hotel was within walking distance to the Chicago Theater which was a big plus.The front desk staff was very nice and check in was a breeze. Our room was on the 21st floor and provided awesome views of the city. The room included a mini fridge, microwave and a coffee pot which was convenient. The room was clean and fresh. The bathroom was big and spotless. The only issues was that the pillows were on the hard side for our preference. The rooms have flat screens and the WiFi connection was flawless. The elevators are fast even when they are busy. We had the breakfast buffet at the Weber Grill. This was an amazing breakfast to say the least. There was so much to choose from so everyone should be satisfied. The wait staff was very kind as well and checked up on us often. I highly recommend this place to any traveler, looking to stay in the city. Looking forward to staying here again in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago IL, downtown Winter stay”
Reviews.Author: RCRCTucson_az
Reviews.Content: Hilton Garden Inn Chicago Downtown/Magnificent Mile was reasonable priced and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We were new to the city and they provided accurate directions and recommendations. Great service! They even called our room to check on us. The hotel is clean, has frig, microwave and gym. It is about 2-3 block walk to Magnificent Mile shops and about 4-5 blocks to see Chicago theater area. Just about 2 blocks to the house of blues. My only dissatisfaction was the parking fee of $49.00 dollars a day. It almost cost as much as the room! I do recommend doing Chicago in warmer weather too.

Reviews.Title: “Just back from another great stay at the HGI Chicao”
Reviews.Author: firsedge
Reviews.Content: Have got back after staying with them for another 4 days (and an additonal 1 day the week before). Rooms clean and early check-in was available. As always GREAT (free for HH Gold)breakfast in the Webber Grill - cooked to order. Also had a meal in the Webber Grill one evening - good value and recommend the pork chops. Excellent location, just off Michigan Ave for all the shops, and does have Starbucks opposite which is useful. The internet access in the room is free (HH Gold) and is pretty fast; also coffee maker, fridge and microwave which is useful. Good gym and adequate swimming pool. Business centre available for printing any documents you need. Staff always welcome you with a smile. My only comment is the TV volume does not turn down lower than "7" for some reason on any of the TV's in various rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat guest because it was great!”
Reviews.Author: aislinn3912
Reviews.Content: If you book online you can get a great deal on price. They were extremely hospitable. The rooms were great, clean. Actually staying there a second time because I know it will be great. Awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights - it is very conveniently located and if you are using the subway - L - its on the red Line, the station is 'Grand' right beside the Hotel. Also beside the Hotel great restaurants and Shops like Bloomingdales and Nordstrom. I arrived late and was welcomed and quickly checked in , later I came down and needed a taxi and the Front Desk agent went out to the street in the freezing Chicago weather to flag a cab for me. The rooms are spacious and have all the facilites that you are used to in a Hilton like Coffee Making facilities,etc.The hotel also offers free Wifi :) I had breakfast in the Weber restaurant on the two mornings and the service, menu offerings were fantastic.They also have a great bar with great bar food and beer selections , although if you are a guest at the Hotel you will need to show ID to charge items to your room . I also was impressed by the genuine frendliness of the colleagues and for their concern that you are having an enjoyable stay. Can definitely recommend this Hotel in downtown Chicago , and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: AMSMike08
Reviews.Content: I took the family for a work, a conference and some play time for the first full week of January. The people at the hotel were great. The rooms come with fridge and microwave which was wonderful since a trader joe's is only 2 blocks away. Location was also very good. The Red Line station is on the same corner as the hotel, Navy Pier is a short walk, and the dining in the area is amazing. I am planning to write a letter to the hotel management to thank them for the wonderful stay and to single out Alexander, a bellhop who went out of the way to make sure we were taken car of on the way in and on our last day. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Just another average hotel”
Reviews.Author: KSM715
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here in July of 2011. Our main reason for staying at this hotel was the location. It's only a few blocks from Michigan Avenue and close to a lot of restaurants and bars. My husband is a Hilton Diamond member and got us a room on points. We booked the room 1 month in advance and specifically asked for 2 queen size beds. To our dismay, the hotel reservation did not make note of our request, so we got a king size bed. I called the front desk and they told me that they cannot help. I was expecting them to offer us an incentive but it seemed like they didn't care much. The rooms are also very small. I noticed that a lot of the guests were young college students and they were pretty rowdy in the lobby and the halls. As part of our stay, we did get two free breakfast certificates to dine at the Weber Grill downstairs. We waiting for 90 minutes and then got seated in an area that smelled like mold. It was gross. I will not stay at this hotel again...probably will choose another Hilton downtown.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Deborah F
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful girlsweekend experience in Chicago. Hotel is centrally located to all our needs (shopping and eating!) and the hotel staff was very helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: AFANOFSANDALS
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Chicago. We chose a hotel based on location, and this one was perfect! We walked to Navy Pier and were right on the Magnificent Mile. The standard room was sufficient but still pricey. It was obvious you pay for the location! We loved having the Weber Grill in the hotel! We ate there and also got excellent room service from there. Again... Pricey but worth it! When you go to Chicago, you can expect to spend a lot. However, it's always worth it! Great times, great hotel, and overall another great trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything I needed for a great Chicago stay”
Reviews.Author: EnergyBender
Reviews.Content: I spent 10 days here while on business in Chicago. The location of this hotel was perfect for my purpose here. There are countless restaurants and retail stores within a short walk. The red line station is just outside the door. I ate breakfast at the Weber Grill most mornings and it was very good. Better than the normal HGI breakfast which is always good. The room I had was a little smaller than I expected but adequate. The hotel staff was professional and efficient. The price was surprisingly reasonable for this quality of hotel and location. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: karen j
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here over the Christmas holiday. Weber Grill restaurant was very good. The staff was helpful, our room was spacious, and just steps away from shopping. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff, but hotel could use some updates”
Reviews.Author: AJR2000
Reviews.Content: The staff is the best feature. They were all very friendly and accomodating. The workout room was small, but clean and well stocked with towels etc. We didn't experience any problems and don't really have any major complaints. If you are traveling with family this is your place, but for a romantic getaway or an upscale hotel this isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Old, small rooms and not up to date”
Reviews.Author: Andi H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as we had to stay an extra night in Chicago and the Conrad was full. it was less than a $100 less than our room at the Conrad but a world away in space, comfort and modernisation. The hotel wasnt bad, it just wasbnt great. Old carpets, Tvs, beds, faint wiff of Cigarettes [when did the smoking ban come in Chicago?]. better around for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: AEgan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on business and everything was great! My company reserved the room for me, and got an amazing deal for downtown Chicago. The room was spacious and comfortable. Bathroom was a little small, but fine. The coffee shop in the lobby is Starbucks (coffee only though, the food is from the hotel). Also nice to have the room service option from Weber Grill. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Hotels”
Reviews.Author: chetcosby
Reviews.Content: This is always a great hotel to stay at when visiting the windy city. Great people, nice rooms, great service and always a great place to rest your body in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “great, "no negatives" stay”
Reviews.Author: CentILMatt
Reviews.Content: very polite doorman wheeled luggage in for us; super quick and friendly service at check-in; front desk and concierge very helpful giving us directions; room was very clean & beds extremely comfortable; common areas clean and well-decorated; hotel very accommodating in holding our luggage for better part of a day, between the time we checked-out and before we caught our train; did not use pool or eat at hotel restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a good value”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravelfamily4
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times and would stay again. Good location, simple hotel, but nice new rooms, quiet and the beds are great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Service, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Stacy7201
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location for shopping and dining. The rooms are spacious and clean. The hotel staff is nice. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MustaphaEido
Reviews.Content: Since I previously stayed and liked the Hilton Garden Inn Chicago Downtown Magnificent Mile in 2008 I decided this year to stay again in this hotel . A very good location within few steps to the magnificent mile ,a free wireless internet connection for all guests . Warm welcome you face from the moment you enter the hotel till you reach your room . A very cooperative staff working all the time to provide the best service and resolve all the problem you may face during your stay . I asked for remaking my bed and changing the sheets since i arrived and did not like the look of the sheets i was surprised that Miss Morgan from the reception desk sent me the house keeper with two bottle of water and a very nice fruit basket . It was a pleasant stay for me and I can not forget to mention Miss Suzana Salovic the front office supervisor whom i respect and think that she will have a bright future in her job . what I only did not like for my last stay is that the manager insist to charge me for an early check out ,it would have been better to me if he or she directly talked to me or at least sent me a note signed by him or her . Anyway thanks to everyone working at the Hilton Garden Inn Chicago for making my stay so warm and unforgettably pleasant. In a nutshell , this hotel is a home far away from home for me and I will defiantly stay there next year .

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff. Recongizes returning guests”
Reviews.Author: jamesteroh
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location a couple times and have always been pleased with the stay. I was in Chicago for a weekend get away this past weekend and stayed at this property on Saturda night. Very easy to get to on the train. If you are coming from Ohare just transfer from the blue line at Jackson to the red and the hotel is literally right outside the grand street red line. Using Midway I know the hotel recomends trasnferring trains but I find it easier to just get off the orange line at State and Lake and walking a few blocks over than dealing with the tunnel tunnel at Roosevelt. It isn't much further of a walk from Lake than the tunnel is and you don't have to wait on a second train. I think the hottub is nice but the pool is too small. I have never used it since it's always full of kids whenever I use the hottub and would be too hard to swim laps in even if it was empty. Fitness center is small but well mantained. Checkin is always great. Last stay I was recognized as a returning guest to the property and thanked for my loyalty as a Hilton Diamond member. My room was ready even though I arrived around 11:30 a.m. and in the keypack was a letter thanking me for returning to the property. Was also given the two free bottles of water without asking. I was also asked if I wanted the free breakfast of the bonus HH points as my choice selection for that stay. The free breakfast is your typical HGI buffett and it's at the weber grill. Even at 10:30 a.m. on Sunday though there was a wait on a table so I sat at the bar. The weber grill is a great place for lunch or dinner and they have room charging privledges. You can also get a free starbucks drink of your choice and a pasty instead with your breakfast voucher. The guy that works the kiosk is really nice but their hours are awful, they are only open until 11 or 12 even on the weekends and they don't have much of a pastry selection. Business center is really nice for printing boarding passes and accessing the internet. The htels free wifi works great, very fast for a hotel and reliable. You can walk out the hotel and the red line is right there which is great if you need train service. Near a lot of places to eat (Mother Hubbards a block away is a great sports bar and the Faroyo self serve frozen yogurt stop a block away on state is a good place to go to satisfy your sweet tooth). Michigan and State street stopping are only a few mintues away walking. All the staff is great and I have never been denyed an early check in or late check out if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Garden Inn Chicago Downtown / Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: Rob P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a GREAT property!! Staff was very friendly. They found out I was celebrating my anniversary and upgraded me at no charge. They even sent a complimentary bottle of champaign to my room!! This is a GREAT location and you will be within walking distance to everything you want to do. THIS IS A GREAT PLACE TO STAY!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, service and location”
Reviews.Author: r j
Reviews.Content: We were able to check in early with out a hitch. Front desk folks are very friendly and helpful (special thanks to Marshal). Nice room with frig, micro and plenty of space This was not our fist time staying here and hopefully not the last..

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: JeanneK4
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Hilton Garden Inn while in Chicago for a concert at the House of Blues. The staff and service was wonderful! The rooms are very nice, updated, and clean. I would definitely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, good downtown Chicago location!”
Reviews.Author: mhenry59
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Hilton Garden Inn, while in Chicago for an appointment at the French consulate on Michigan Avenue. The front desk and valet staff were all very helpful with our last minute paperwork needs, and providing directions and walking/driving advice. Valet parking is $42/night. The hotel is very convenient to the attractions that downtown Chicago has to offer. There were a lot of great stores as well as many, many restaurants within walking distance. We walked to the "Bean" and enjoyed some tasty deep dish Chicago pizza and Garrets popcorn on the way back. I found the beds wonderful, but the noise from the rooms next door, the hallway and street noise (sirens, horns, etc. that could even be heard on the 16th floor) were all slightly annoying. The hotel's free internet was appreciated, but for some reason the location took over my blackberry's internet access. Overall, a very good visit, for a relatively good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good property, excellent staff- will return again!”
Reviews.Author: Cory S
Reviews.Content: I was in the Hilton Garden Inn for 6 nights... very comfortable property... great location.. near Michigan Ave... and a subway spot just out the door. Weber Grill provides great meals (and is popular at night.. kinda noisy, but alternatives like PF Chang's and Cantina Laredo and RB Grill near. Also near Nordstrom and Northbridge. The staff was very friendly and just as helpful. Valets, front desk and housekeeping were all great. Obviously well managed. The bathrooms while spotlessly clean could use an update. However.. it's a great value, so leave them alone and keep the prices as they are!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every aspect.”
Reviews.Author: jpscoffee
Reviews.Content: My family and I wanted to find a reasonable hotel down by the Michigan Mile for a quick weekend getaway. We selected the HGI and were very happy with our choice. The staff were excellent, the room was clean, comfortable and well appointed. I've stayed at other Hotels in Chicago and this was one of the best values for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: I wanted to say that everyone at this hilton garden inn was nice, but George in the valet was "super friendly, nice, helpful". It was just wonderful after a 5 hour drive to stop and have some body you don't even know great you like family. He just helped to make our Chicago trip even more memorable for the right reason. Thanks George and the staff...

Reviews.Title: “Large guest rooms for Chicago”
Reviews.Author: IrishAyes8490
Reviews.Content: The great thing about this hotel is that unlike many others in Chicago, the rooms are large and have two queen (not double) beds. Also having the Weber Grill restaurant on property is convenient, if for no other reason than its bar. Be aware, however -- no complimentary continental breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “mtemple”
Reviews.Author: Margaret T
Reviews.Content: We had an ingredible weekend here. It was our 51st anniversary and the hotel acknowledged it by sending us a tray of wine & goodies. The staff was very gracious and helpful. We are hilton honor people but we seem to favor Hilton Garden Inns so we always try them first. The breakfast was fabulous. Thank you again for giving us great memories.

Reviews.Title: “another fine H.G.I”
Reviews.Author: naturekid
Reviews.Content: friendly staff. Aked for some pizza delivery menus at about 11pm at the front desk, and we went with the one the lady reccmonded (sarpinos, I think) very good. The location was great for everything we wanted to do. there are several convience stores wihin a block or two. walking distance to just about anything you would be in that area of chicago for. even the free casino shuttle to the hammond horseshoe was only several blocks. $39 a night for self park seemed a little steep, then we noticed some of the other surrounding garages. turned out on par, if not reasonable in comparison. Beds and pillows were super comfy. price seemed to be better than other close hotels, and can't imagine an extra $20 or $40 a night gets you anything that much better. they let us check in at 12:30pm, only we were worried because we were right next to the elevator (proabaly because those get cleaned first). turned out as an advantage as we didn't notice any extra noise, and then didn't have to walk all the way down the hall either. will stay here next time for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nikki G
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights here during set-up for a tradeshow at McCormick Place. The hotel boasts a decent restaurant offering meals throughout the day and offers a wealth of eateries, bars, pubs, and shops within feet. I walked the five or so blocks to Macy's on State Street one evening and it was busy enough to feel safe doing so, despite the fact I was a female traveling alone. The hotel itself was comfortable and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The pool and hot tub allow you to relax after a hard day while the city busies itself around you. My only complaint is that there were issues with the volume on my television. The engineer came and took the plug out and plugged it in again (that old trick) and explained that sometimes the TVs need to reset themselves. However, the same thing happened the next morning and this time it didn't help to simply unplug the power cord and plug it back in. Nevertheless, I would definitely stay here again. One thing I LOVED (and I have stayed in a lot of hotels) is the fact they have a plug socket ON the lamp base on your nightstand. No more groveling behind headboards or chests of drawers looking for somewhere to plug in your cell or laptop within easy reach of the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: styrlup
Reviews.Content: SImply a beautiful run hotel with an extremely attentive and friendly staff. New fresh interior. Superb location in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended spot in good location”
Reviews.Author: Uksnowy
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here and had a lovely room with a city view in this vibrant part of Chicago, north of the River. We had lost a suitcase at the airport and all of the staff went out of their way to help us retrieve it. The atmosphere was very friendly and everything worked well. The bed was extremely comfortable, with a gadget to change its softness/hardness -- just what we needed after a long flight. Also near some great restaurants, and across the street from a supermarket/drugstore, which was very handy. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “buyer beware: not what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: snowonder
Reviews.Content: Reserve and pay for a non-smoking room in advance? Too bad. These folks will give you a smoking room on a smoking floor and there's nothing you can do except apply eye drops and take aspirin and never stay at Hilton Gardens again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: tbr48
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn in Chicago while attending a wedding. The room was clean, well furnished, and quiet. The hotel is in a great location a couple of blocks off Michigan Ave. and all the shopping. Also there is a subway stop right in front of the hotel so we had no trouble taking the train from the airport. The people at front desk were very helpful and printed our our airline boarding passes for us. Overall I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but room slipped thru the cracks, then so did I.....”
Reviews.Author: 99p38a
Reviews.Content: Checked in late at night, went to room with wife and baby in tow. Room was FREEZING, AC on coolest and fan on highest. Room had a strong deodorizer smell to it. I sat on the chair and moved the ottoman and found the end of a marijuana cigarette. Lucky my daughter didn't find that! I took it to the desk and they apologized and offered breakfast the next day, but we already had plans. He said "I will take care of you with points then" I said, thanks and never inquired to how many or any other details. I assumed that an industry professional would handle it with the appropriate amount in a timely manner. I appreciate it. He offered to move my room, but I had my daughter and we were all settled, just didn't want to do it. I never got the points. I spent until 3 months emailing the hotel and hilton customer care back and forth to get some compensation. It was more about principle than the points. I do not appreciate lack of follow thru. Things happen, the hotel was nice, the staff was friendly and the follow up emails were nice. Just such a long process. If they would have tailored compensation before I left (which is what I assumed by the way he said he'd take care of me with points), I would have rated all 5s here except cleanliness. The room wasn't dirty, they just missed the roach. Good location, lots to do nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Friedly”
Reviews.Author: Bucks3333
Reviews.Content: Although an older, maybe somewhat oudated hotel - the clenliness, friendliness and overall positive experience make this hotel a great place to stay. It was competitive in price and close to everything we wanted to see. I cant stress the friendly and helpful staff - we travel alot, and were greatly impressed by the people who work there.

Reviews.Title: “Great property and great location.”
Reviews.Author: mjbphx
Reviews.Content: Reception is on the 1st floor and hotel starts on the 12th floor. Everything is excellent, including the rooms (although the bathroom was unexpectedly small), the furnishings, internet, fitness equipment, Weber Grill Restaurant on site, and service. Room also had a microwave and refrigerator (with a Jewel Grocery across the street). Location adjacent to the train and across from Nordstroms is great. Stayed 4 nights and was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - but got bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Jennys-a
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a 3-night stay at this hotel. It's central to everything and we had room 1701 with 2 queen beds, perfect for 2 adults with 2 kids. However, I woke up the 2nd day with large red bumps on my arm and initially thought they were mosquito bites, which seemed odd for a chilly October 23rd in Chicago, and I was wearing a coat and sweaters all the time. By the next day they had swelled, itched horribly and had open sores. I realized that they were not mosquito bites. I showed my bites to the front desk staff at check out and suggested they investigate for bed bugs. The first reaction from the staff person was "I can guarantee you we don't have bed bugs" and "could I possibly have sensitive skin?" I assured her I didn't have sensitive skin and asked her if she was prepared to personally guarantee that the room is free of bed bugs, and she then changed her tune and asked if I wanted to write a report. She offered me antibiotic ointment which I gladly accepted (I was itching like made). I've googled pics of bed bug bites and mine match them exactly. Ewwwwwww. Sure hope she makes good and files that report with management.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the location and a decent price!”
Reviews.Author: Josh W
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. The room was nicer than the room at the Hilton Chicago. It was also cheaper and internet was free. It had a great location to get to the Navy Pier, a ton of restaurants, shopping, and clubs. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, first rate staff”
Reviews.Author: Dorsalfin
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, could use a few more elevators, though. I was put on the 23d floor and it was always a long wait and slow ride to/from the lobby. The hotel is on the Red Line, so it's not a direct trip to O'Hare...you have to change at Jackson for the Blue Line. The Weber Grill in the lobby seems to attract lots of locals and the food/beer selection is terrific. I was there for a corporate event and the rate was $175 a night, but otherwise it would be $250. My room was large and the beds comfy with amazing Pacific Coast pillows (that I bought myself on line as soon as I got home).

Reviews.Title: “Well-located and well-priced”
Reviews.Author: WinnipegSteve
Reviews.Content: This hotel is adjacent to the Magnificent Mile, and near everything you need. It is situation directly next to a subway station (Red Line), and across the street from an Osco Drugs grocery store. My room had a king bed, refrigerator, and microwave, along with the usual accoutrements. Free wifi is included in all rooms, and there is a nice business center open 24 hours a day with computers, printers, photocopiers, etc... The hotel lobby has a Starbucks. Pricing was very competitive ($190/night), for this type of hotel in this area. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely good choice for Downtown Sight Seeing”
Reviews.Author: lkgtraveler
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel from reading reviews on Trip Advisor. The reservation was easy to make and the person was very patient with all my questions & familiar with the area & knowledgeable to the location and what was available. From the entrance It was very welcoming, warm & accomodating. The room was clean, very comfortable and equipped with a fridge & mircro and since we were staying a couple nights that came in handy. There was a great grocery right across the street with wonderful fruits, veggies and home made deli items. The restaurant in the hotel "The Weber Grill" was very good but pricey as most in the downtown tourist areas but the convenience was worth it. We got tickets to a Cubs game at Wrigley Field and caught the El (subway) right outside the hotel door. There was a free shuttle 2 blks away to the Navy Pier and from there attractions were steps away. The architectural cruise was worth the price for an over view and short history of Chicago's history. The staff was incredibly friendly, helpful and all questions were answered plesantly. If we asked a question that the staff person didn't know they didn't send us off to someone else they went and got the answer for us. Definitely worth the stay and the rate was awesome for a downtown hotel convenient to the tourist areas. I did not use the indoor pool but did use the business center's computers a few times. I wouldn't spend the extra $10. for a city view room since the hotel is sandwiched between other larger buildings my city view was of the hi rise next door albeit it had a nice running track and greenery on one of it's outside decks not quite the view I expected.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't have been more pleased!”
Reviews.Author: Soozi13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn because the large hotel where my workshop was scheduled didn't book a large enough block of rooms. It worked out just great because I couldn't have been happier with my stay at the Hilton. From the helpful front desk staff to the clean and comfortable room, it had everything I needed for my 3-night stay. It even had a microwave so that I could heat up my leftover Chicago deep dish pizza! I looked forward to the indoor jacuzzi after long days of walking and workshops. Because it is not a mega-hotel, the lobby is civilized and quiet, as was the room. The location is terrific and close to attractions and shopping. I'd do back in a heartbeat and have recommended this hotel to friends already.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service - Great property”
Reviews.Author: JStill636
Reviews.Content: Let me preface by saying that I spend 100+ nights a year in hotels across the USA in all price ranges and have done so for more than 20 years. This one was a standout from the moment of my arrival to my departure 3 days later. Very nice downtown location. It was a really good value for my visit. Room(s) I stayed in were a Parlor room and a regular King Non-Smoking during a 3 day stay, mid week. Both rooms were clean and neat. The Weber Grill was splendid for both breakfast and dinner. However, the real delight of the visit was the front office team. One does not expect such a warm and efficient greeting and service from large urban hotels but this team is excellent. A particular standout was Mirsada Hajdarevic, who was attentive, gracious and went out of her way to make me feel both welcome and appreciated. Even the housekeeping staff were very responsive. While I don't usually stay in downtown Chicago, this will be my home away from home when I am in the area next. Congratulations to the management of this hotel! Now if only my other stays were staffed by people like Mirsada, I'd enjoy traveling as frequently as I do a great deal more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: crystalball_06
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right down town in walking distance of everything! It was clean and modern looking. Staff was very friendly. Parking is very expensive at $39 per day, but that's average for anywhere downtown. The pool was very small, but clean. Grocery store right across the street, and a fridge and mircrowave in room. Price was expensive for me, but average for downtown locations. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, wish it was longer...”
Reviews.Author: PASL23
Reviews.Content: Can't think of anything bad to say, location, room condition, service, restaurant all exceeded our expectations. Front desk staff always greeted us when walking through the lobby, you don't see that a lot with your average Hilton Garden Inn.

Reviews.Title: “We'd go back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: jules1973Woodridge
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the location and convenience of being right in the city. It was great for that reason but also for the comfort. We'll come back here for sure. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with conveniences”
Reviews.Author: EasygoingE
Reviews.Content: I was booked here with my company as part of trade show at Navy Pier. My stay was for two nights and I had no complaints about the room. Check-in was very easy and while my room wasn't available (I was early) and the lines were steady, the employees very friendly & accomodating. The hotel room was spacious, clean and well-kept. Our group ate at Weber Grill, and everyone seemed pleased with their meal. Our trade show had arranged for a shuttle to take us to the Pier, otherwise it would have been a steady 25 minute walk. I wouldn't recommend as an easy access to that location if a shuttle isn't available. There were plenty of taxis, though, if we didn't want to even wait until the next shuttle. My only complaint was about the level of street noise, which prevented me from getting a solid night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: magic8177
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great area, a 5 minute walk to the Mag Mile with access to many shops and restaurants all within walking distance. The hotel is what you expect, the rooms were clean so you can't ask for much more. Overall it's a great place to stay if you want to be within walking distance of a lot of the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PTCDad
Reviews.Content: This HGI provided a perfect location for us to discover Chicago with our two girls. The State Street subway is essentially in the basement of the hotel. Water Tower, Michigan Ave., Navy Pier, Millenium Park and the Art Institute were easy (and interesting) walks. As some reviews have noted, the hotel lobby is not grand, but that did not diminish our stay. The restaurant is unusual for an HGI -- it appears to be a Weber Grill flagship store. Only had breakfast there, but it was better than a typical HGI. Lunch/dinner looked fine, but there were so many great restaurant choices around we couldn't get to everything! Rooms were more than adequate in size and were quite clean. Good TV and lighting. Heater/Air Conditioner was the old under-the-window style with thermostat on the wall. It was a bit loud. Windows did a poor job of blocking out sound, even 14 floors up. If you are from the city and used to noise all night, it won't bother you. It bothered us. Would I stay here again? Perhaps. The rate was reasonable and the location was great. Just wish they would have gotten better windows.

Reviews.Title: “Ok rooms, thin doors, nice smiling staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Crazy33Italy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing special, itâ€™s simple, the rooms are ok but not flashy and some improvement could be made regarding the old furniture, especially the doorsâ€¦the room doors are so old and thin you can actually hear people talking and walking whenever they are in the corridor even if they are far away. The air circulating system at this hotel is not good, if the old-looking air/con system is switched off, it is actually difficult to breathe so we tried to stay out of the room as much as possible. There is free-wifi in the rooms which is a plus. All Hilton Garden Inns provide shampoo, conditioner, mouthwash and body lotion, but no shower gelâ€¦.they give you soapâ€¦ The location of this hotel is great, there is a subway stop just outside the door but the hotel is close to everything, so you can walk everywhere too. No noise coming from outside of the hotel. The staff is always smiling and nice, very welcoming and helpful, especially the girls at reception from Montenegro and the guy at the hotel entrance door. The Web Grill restaurant is very nice, we had breakfast there twice and we liked it, the price is ok and the food is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Glassgirl8550
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Perfect location. Wonderful service. We will be back again

Reviews.Title: “Nicest staff, terrific location”
Reviews.Author: ChanUSA
Reviews.Content: Great location near Magnificent Mile. Walking distance (about 20 mins. to Millennium Park, Navy Pier and Oak St. Beach. Staff was really pleasant and helpful. During my stay I even received a call inquiring if there was anything else needed. There was a small but nice and warm pool, very clean, and great spa tub. I went during the day when few people were there. Weber's Grill was conveniently located downstairs. I enjoyed the Wendella Boat Tour, with great architectural views from the Chicago River and Lake Michigan. This was an unexpected stopover in Chicago due Hurricane Irene but it was a wonderful weekend in a fantastic city and a very nice hotel. Enjoyed the

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, Expensive, Noisy”
Reviews.Author: OccaisionalTravel
Reviews.Content: The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Even all the housekeepers seem genuinely pleasant when they greeted you. I'm a completely tightwad but when the lobby attendant stopped to make change for me so I didn't have to wait in line at the front desk, I was sold. The locations was great. The workout area was reasonably complete for a hotel. My only real complaint, other than $45/night to park my car was how bad the doors were at controlling noise in the rooms. It was like everyone talking in the hallway or the ajoining room was right next to me in bed.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel in a great area of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: leesh96
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the Chicago downtown area on numerous occasions and have stayed at this Chicago HGI a couple of times. It's a good 'bedrock' hotel when you're looking for reliable and comfortable stay and when you don't desire all the frills of a four star. The area is great and walking distance to most of the major offices as well as close proximity to many great restaurants. Check in at the hotel is quick and courteous. Make sure you get one of their tasty fresh and warm cookies! The elevators in my humble opinion are too few for the number of rooms and may involve a slightly higher than average wait. Not a big deal - as long as you're not in a rush to get to the office! The room itself is slightly below average in size for Chicago but all the amenities that one requires are there including a nice desk and back supporting chair. It was also very neat and clean. The bathroom was clean and the water pressure was average. The toiletries are as you would expect for a HGI. The beds are comfortable and supportive and they provide 2 queens typically. As a gold member, I was entitled to a free breakfast at the attached Weber Grill restaurant. This was one of my favorite parts. The breakfast, which I asked to be made to order was fantastic. The omelet was exceptional and the pancakes were light and fluffy. The atmosphere here in the breakfast bar is very reminiscent of what you'd expect in an New York type upscale diner. I was impressed every time I was there. The parking here for in and out customers is valet only and they have a great text messaging system where you can request your car conveniently at any time. The valets themselves are also very friendly are are deserving of the tips they get. In conclusion, the Chicago HGI is one of my favorite hotels in the downtown area and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a good reliable no frills stay.

Reviews.Title: “If you have to stay downtown, this is a good choice.”
Reviews.Author: Flyinlow427vette
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel twice, once 5 years ago, and again August 2011. The hotel has been updated since my first stay. As others mentioned, they greet you with a cold water at check in, and the staff was very friendly. The rooms are larger than you would expect, and nicely appointed including flat screen tv and micro-fridge. My only complaint about this hotel is that the noise from the city streets makes the rooms noisier than most, especially in a city that always has sirens and street noise. Parking is very expensive at about $40 a day in the parking garage I used. If you are looking to walk in the downtown area this is a great choice though as you have easy access to restaurants, shopping, and even Navy Pier is walkable.

Reviews.Title: “Come for the service, stay for the service”
Reviews.Author: AndrewTO
Reviews.Content: Just utterly lovely. I walked into the lobby, tired, and the person who greeted me (tall-ish, lanky blond guy) warmly greeted me and got me a bottle of water. The desk staff were equally wonderful. And it didn't stop. They were just superb. (This was on a Friday, daytime.) So why not more starts? The room was relentlessly corporate--no surprise--and although the bed was fantastic, the atmosphere was just deadening. Very clean and neat, but it gave new meaning to the word "soulless." Yes, okay, it's a big chain hotel. But I've stayed at others and they've been really comfy and ambient. Not one thing about this place made it seem warm or inviting. Sure, I'd recommend staying here nevertheless--but there must be better. And what made it better than any place I've ever stayed is the service. It's like they REALLY care about you.... or maybe they actually do!! I was totally impressed and it made my trip. Give these people raises or something, because they are your hotel, Mr Hilton. A side note about the Weber Grill, the attached resto. I had the buffet breakfast. Nice people but inattentive service. Ditto dinner. The many maitre'd people roaming around couldn't look more put upon or unhappy. One hour wait for our reservation. Mind you, I had THE BEST burger of my life, seriously. Dinner service itself was good. So, a mixed experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great attitudes by employees- would stay again”
Reviews.Author: taiwandave
Reviews.Content: My normal hotels were booked so we took a chance on trying a new one...very scary in chicago because of places like the Knickerbocker which is a run down dump with horribly rude staff and managers that lie and never follow through. However, this Hilton property exceeded our expectations and the price was incredibly low- $155/night avg cost for a 4 night stay. First the bad: Towels! Typical large, clean and white Hilton towels but they are as rough as sandpaper...medium course sand paper! Seriously it hurt to wipe your face they were so stiff. Other issue was the elevators on one day only 1 worked or the others were locked out- whatev, but you had to wait in line for one and the line was often 40+ people long and of course for the trip down you had to wait NUMEROUS times for one to have enough room to squeeze in since we were on 15th floor we just took stairs down. Thankfully this only lasted half of the day to my knowledge. Last "complaint" isn't really a complaint but you are deep in the heart of toursit mecca and since I use to live in Chi-town this does not appeal to me but if you are a tourist this could be a plus since there are numerous chain restaurants right near you in all directions. Lastly, room service is via the Weber Grill Restaurant- b-fast bar is $15 and not very good and room service ends when Weber Grill closes at 11pm. That is a bummer since when we get in at 1am and want a snack we have to head out. They do have a SMALL food closet next to front desk but not much to choose from your better hiking to 7/11. For the good: Clean modern rooms as you would expect. Check in was a breeze and they were very professional and polite. They also honored my request for an end room for quietness and it was quiet. Decent views fyi the hotel rooms start at floor 13 and go up to 23...I think. Small pool and workout room is on floor 12 and adequate as long as the children are kept civil or you get up early enough to beat the families. House keeping was on the ball! They even followed up on our requests and we gladly tipped them well daily for fresh sheets. I had the reservation in my name and my other half arrived from Seattle before I arrived from NYC I was expecting a HUGE hassle to get her on the reservation since I did the prepaid but they took care of it at the property and she was refreshed and waiting in the room for me. I really appreciated that. Overall I am still loyal to Dana, Four Seasons and Wyndham but now I know I have another option of a great hotel in Chicago- highly recommend this place for couples and short stays if you can handle being in the overly crowded tourist "mecca." But if you know good food and the neighborhoods it's all good once you get a few blocks away and make the trip more like home.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful base with great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Sian48
Reviews.Content: A great place. Ver friendly and helpful staff who will go the extra mile. Thank you Amelia for cleaning our room so thoroughly each day!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Savvytravlur
Reviews.Content: Took a family trip to Chicago and this was a perfect location for us. Close to Michigan Ave. where buses to the museums can be caught - walk to Michigan via Ohio. PF Chang's less than 1 block. Navy Pier Reilly 1 block. Jewel market across the street. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Only improvements are fan in bathroom and MUCH less chlorine in hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “great location! walk to everything!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalfam92673
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at Hilton Garden Inn in Chicago. Room was great, very comfy, great city view! Staff was super friendly and helpful. Fridge and micro come in handy and saved us alot of money not eating every meal out. There's a grocery store right across the street to stock up on drinks, snacks, etc. We walked everywhere! Gino's East, Michigan Ave, Navy Pier, we even walked up the lakeshore from Millenium park to Navy Pier and then down Grand Ave to our hotel. We took taxis to some further out locations near south side and also to Lincoln park zoo, fares were not bad, like $10-$15. Chicago is such a fun city! So much to do! This hotel is a great location. Lots of restaurants nearby and only a couple blocks to the river. So beautiful! One of our favorite outings was the architecture boat tour...highly recommend! Also, Tommy Guns dinner show was lots of fun for the family! ps... Free wifi for Hilton honors members!!

Reviews.Title: “Beats the higher rates of other top tier properties, but on the north side of river.”
Reviews.Author: MHTbased
Reviews.Content: Classic Hilton Garden Inn decor, but a great view. I was on 17 so ask for a room above 15. I also liked that their restaurant was the Weber Grill - you know, like the BBQ. Good for breakfast, lunch & dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Gemuse4
Reviews.Content: A great location a couple blocks off Michigan Ave and close to great restaurants and shopping. Rooms were comfortable and clean! Staff was friendly and helpful. Only suggestion would be that the bathrooms have a fan to avoid steaming up of the mirror after a shower!

Reviews.Title: “They know how to treat guests but specify if you want NON-SMOKING room”
Reviews.Author: Megnzay
Reviews.Content: Our trip started out a little rocky when they put us in a "smoking" room but then changed it the next night to non-smoking for the balance of the trip. Make sure you specify and DEMAND non-smoking before arrival. I travel quite often and did not realize that hotels still had "smoking room floors"! They were nice to provide complimentary breakfast tickets for the inconvenience as well as complimentary parking. We would have expected the pool to be open later than 11pm in this city so we were unable to use the accomodations due to just missing the closing time. There is currently construction infront of the hotel which makes it a little challenging to enter and exit the hotel. We was never any noise heard from our room due to construction. The rest of the stay was comfortable, quiet and a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: kirbymcseamus
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay here. The staff was friendly and our room was fine. We had two windows but one faced a brick wall (although it still let light in) and we could see the Hancock tower from the street-front window. The bed was fine even though we forgot about the adjustable comfort feature. The hotel is within walking distance of a number of attractions including the dock for the CFA boat tour and Millennium Park. There is also a subway stop right on the corner. This made taking the train to the hotel when we departed a breeze and gave us more options for lunch and dinner. The breakfast (free for HHonors gold members) was great for a buffet that included made-to-order hot options as well as basics like oatmeal and plain yogurt. Perhaps the only negative is that the A/C fan unit was extremely loud, and there was only one setting when it was on. I had to resort to earplugs after the first night. Without the fan, there was some street noise audible in our 13th floor room prior to midnight on the weekend. I would stay here again and would recommend it to anyone looking to explore downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: marhuck
Reviews.Content: The only thing to complain about was the room wasn't ready until after 5 pm when we checked in. The rooms were nice and clean. There was a mini fridge and microwave. Very convenient for walking to all the great attractions in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “This is our new "go to" place in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: shelcovell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here three times now and have had a wonderful experience each time. The staff is friendly and helpful, from the front desk to the housekeeping staff. The location is perfect for us, as it is close to the train station, some great restaurants, a grocery store, Starbucks! and Michigan Avenue shopping. The rates are reasonable and the rooms are always clean and comfortable. We have stayed in several other places in Chicago over the past few years and this is, by far, our favorite and our new "go to" place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Clean, and Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: Foo-D-GR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and the rooms are nicely appointed for business travelers. With dozens of restaurants and shopping at Nordstrom across the street it was the perfect location for our business meeting. There is also a subway station literally in front of the hotel, so many of us took the mass transit from Midway directly to the hotel - it was only $2.75 and so convenient. Parking is extremely expensive here and the traffic is horrible so we were glad to avoid the rental car altogether. The hotel has a Weber Grille restaurant in the lobby serving very good food for lunch/dinner but it also serves the hotel's breakfast buffet. This was a nice change from the typical American Grille option at HGI properties elsewhere. Try the brisket hash. Yum.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Jumpchic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location with impeccable service. There is construction going on outside the building, but I didn't hear any noise in the room. The business center is on the 12th floor with rooms above that...They even have a 13th floor! From the time I arrived, and checked in at the front desk, the service was great and the room clean and ready. I noticed that there were quite a few sports fans at the hotel, in town for the Cubs/Phillies game, so it must be a good location for baseball games. Two ideas for improvement: Fix the key pad on the business center door (it didn't work), and update the bathrooms (most hotels in this class have granite counters and tile showers.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: mdipierro
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, close to Michigan Ave but just a little quieter. The suites are awesome, I highly recommend them. The fitness center is much better than I expected. Parking was kinda pricey, I'd recommend taking the train or a taxi from the airport and not renting a car. It's easy to get around the city by bus once you are downtown.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: FracasK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights, and let me first say that when I travel for business I often arrive at my hotel stressed and disorganized. Do I have all my phones? Where did I put my computer? Where are my keys...you get the picture. The good people staffing this particular Hilton were amazing, and actually seemed concerned about taking care of me -- from the front desk clerk to the valet, who walked me to my car to find a misplaced phone and made sure I knew my directions when I drove off for a meeting the next day. Even the hotel maids were gracious and welcoming. Seriously, I found the service on par with the Ritz-Carlton up the road (where I stayed back in the day when business was much better...) The only drawbacks I found were the mattress (I have to concur with the other reviewer who mentioned it -- mine was definitely near its expiration date), and I would have liked to know that breakfast was available in the Weber Grill. Other than that, I had a great stay and would definitely stay again for business. Incidentally, this hotel is ideally located for after-work diversions, too -- just behind the North Bridge shops, and only a few blocks from Trump Tower terrace bar -- THE best place for a cocktail on a summer evening!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NKY_10
Reviews.Content: Took a family trip to Chicago so my wife and daughters could do some shopping on Michigan Ave. Hilton Garden Inn is in a perfect location for shopping and many of the local attractions, including Navy Pier, if you are able to walk a little bit. About a mile from Water Tower Place and about the same distance to Navy Pier, right around the corner from the Trump building and just a few blocks from the Wrigley Building and the Chicago River. The staff was very friendly and the hotel was typical Hilton quality. Nicely appointed rooms, which start on the 13th floor to avoid street noise. We were on the 20th floor and street noise was faint and not an issue. Weber Grill restaurant in the lobby looked good and was always busy, but we chose to eat elsewhere. They will also deliver to your room. The swimming pool is located on the 12th floor in a covered solarium overlooking rooftops and buidlings. The pool is a little small, but was never too crowded when we were there. More than four or five kids might get a little cramped. Nice hot tub and plenty of chairs. The water is heavily chlorinated, so much so that you will cough a few times just from breathing the air. Sliding doors help with the ventilation. The air conditioner fan was loud, but not so much that it bothered our sleeping. I could see how it might annoy some people, though. Parking was a bit of a challenge and not cheap. Pulling into the valet port was tricky due to construction out front. We chose to self park to save a few dollars ($39/night vs. $46/valet). Self park garage is located right next to hotel. Elevator takes you right outside hotel lobby. Not too much of an inconvenience, so if you are looking to save money, self-parking will help a little. Overall we had a great experience and we would definitely recommend this hotel based on location, cleanliness and friendliness of staff.

Reviews.Title: “not as good as the other two times”
Reviews.Author: TravelingChumley
Reviews.Content: made a reservation for an AAA and booked a "city view" room. Tried to check in at 2pm, the clerk said the city view rooms were not ready yet. Dropped off the bags and off I go. Return at 11pm, assigned room 1538. There are 22 floors in this hotel, so a city view is half way up the hotel? I saw a brick wall and roof and a very small part of another street. Too tired, I'll complain later. Have a morning detail, so out and about again. Return and order room service. Service was positive. Wake up at 4am to get a work out in. Fitness room and pool open at 5am. I go down to the front desk and the young lady, Tiffany, said the fitness room opens at 5am. "You can't ask security to open it?" "She will not open the fitness room." Poor customer service. This place sounds like the Omni up the street. I'd hope for better service as I'm a Hilton Honor's member with 8 stays this year. A cabbie walks in the lobby and ask, "Who needs a cab?" Tiffany says "no one." "Then why do you have the taxi light on outside?" "I can't turn it off, sorry." Lying through her teeth, when the cabbie leaves, the security lady turns off the taxi light. Turn off the light and too lazy to open the fitness room. The previous two stays here had no problems. I don't plan on staying here again, period.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Carmen1318
Reviews.Content: stayed here with friends during memorial day weekend. we had 8 people in our group, and got 2 rooms for 3 nights, each room having 2 queen beds, which was nice. upon e checking in around 2pm, our rooms were not ready yet, but the staff gladly stored our bags in the back while we went to get pizza at gino's east. the view of the rooms was facing a high rise condo with a outdoor track on the 6th floor and facing mcdonalds. the rooms were your average size rooms and the bathrooms were alright. nothing fancy, but they were clean. the rooms came with an EMPTY refrigerator, which came in handy for storing beer and alcohol for some late night fun :) luckily they weren't booby trapped with motion sensors for those wanting a late night snack or drink. free wireless internet was included with the room, which you can log on with a username and password the front desk provides. the room also had a desk with a desk chair and a lounge chair. the rooms were also big enough to fit 8 people inside for socializing and hanging out without feeling cramped. the hotel is located literally right next to the grand station on the red line train. however, the station was undergoing construction which sometimes created a pedestrian traffic jam exiting the subway station and forced us to J-walk to the front entrance of the hotel. it became a pain to deal with, but not the hotel's fault. other than that, great location in river north. navy pier is 6 blocks away. liquor stores are nearby along with some great restaurants. walking to the loop is just 4 blocks south. i got 2 rooms for 3 nights for $1150 on priceline on a travel-intensive weekend. would suggest to everyone to priceline this hotel to get a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “great location, good rates.”
Reviews.Author: SusanJudd
Reviews.Content: Right off Michigan, just north of the river. 2-bed room was spacious, comfortable and had a frig & microwave. Hotel has a very good restaurant, the neighborhood has numerous restaurants, and there is a grocery store across the street. We love the Hilton points, location, and quality of the rooms, it's our pick for Chicago. (car travelers be aware that parking is very $$$)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nothing spectacular but great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelguy0
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night from saturday to sunday. I arrived early and at that time no non-smoking rooms were available. So I put my stuff in my business partners room and we hit town. When I came back to check-in the receptionist was not to friendly and couldn't locate my reservation at first. After pulling out my HHonors elite card things suddenly improved..... I was put in a room on the 26th floor which was good as expected. Comfortable bed, everything in working condition and clean. The breakfast is served in the Weber Grill restaurant and the server was great. Breakfast is included, which is for me is one of the biggest benefits from the HHonors program. The location is excellent, very close to the sites and shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Indycity
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights over Memorial Day weekend. Pros: The location is great and we were close enough to walk many places. There is a drug store right across the street for anything that you forgot. Warm cookies at the front desk in the afternoon! Rooms are big enough and beds are comfortable. Staff was extremely friendly and the housekeeping staff always had a good morning!, for us and did a great job cleaning the room. Cons: We asked for a city view but we were facing a large building. The pool is small and one family of 15 took up the all of the chairs and the hot tub, squeezing us out. Our tub drain was slow and filled up with water when you showered. The restaurant attached-Weber Grille, was horrible. The hostess was rude, 2 hour wait for sub-standard food. Ribs were tough and the meatloaf full of salt. I would never return to the Weber Grille. Not sure if the hotel is involved with it or not but should be if not. Overall hotel was a good deal but find another restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: canuck64
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. My employer booked this hotel for all our sales reps, and some management, for one week. We combined a sales meeting prior to the annual convention. I shared a room with a co-worker. Room was a decent size with all the modern amenities. Bathroom had plenty of counter space. Considering the amount of traffic going through this hotel, it was quite clean. The Weber Grill restaurant was always busy, and the bar was very nice. Had the breakfast buffet every morning, which was very good, and priced right. Plenty of restaurants in the area, but a little far from the convention center. Chicago is a great city !

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Decent Hotel. Crappy little Pool.”
Reviews.Author: JNB412
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with a great restaurant (Weber Grill) in the lobby. It is only a few block from Michigan Avenue. The rooms were clean and had a nice fridge, microwave and flat panel HD TV. However, like every other hotel I've stayed at in my life the cable/dish channels have never worked at listed. I could not get CBS of FOX. The guy in the next room only got 13 of the channels. For once a hotel with beds that were nice and ones I could sleep, the A/C worked great too (whick is something you don't always see). The pool was tiny and not worthy of a family or lap swim. The workout room was nice. The best feature was the Jewel/Osco across the street, anything you needed right accross the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: gilmorha
Reviews.Content: We would recommend Hilton Garden Inn for the friendly & hepful staff all amenties were provided although the cleaner woyld on accasion forget to replace shampoo etc,but apart from that very clean They will advise and guide you how to go about Chicago The hotel is very central to anywhere you wish to go along Michigan Ave Weber Grill is useful for meals and the Starbucks in the corner is good for early coffee Our room was good and not in a noise good be heard

Reviews.Title: “NOISE”
Reviews.Author: Ajinwun
Reviews.Content: While another reviewer noted that there is no street noise, my room on the 12th floor had so much noise from my neighbor that I WISH there would have been some street noise to drown them out. From the heavy sighs of frustration to them dropping their luggage on the floor....I put some music on before I heard anything else. Rooms were dated but clean, and customer service was excellent! I just wouldn't stay here expecting a quiet stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, uncomfortbale beds, helpful front desk”
Reviews.Author: elizabethky
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights with my parents and my boyfriend. Our room was clean but the beds are very uncomfortable. The location is great. The pool is clean but it has so much chlorine, more than any other pool I've ever been in. Our skin and eyes hurt after a 20 minute swim. The valet parking was great, the desk clerks and housekeeping staff were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barb42256
Reviews.Content: very convenient location. Nice to have pool with kids. Weber restaurant in hotel has great kids' meals.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Niceguyss
Reviews.Content: This was a first time for my family to stay in Chicago downtown. We were relaxing at the room. The view from the window is nice! The hotel personnel such as front desk, room service and valet parking was kind and helpful. There were many restaurant near the hotel and at the corner in the hotel lobby, it is available to buy starbacks coffee in the morning. We orderd classic burguer by room survice, the burguer taste is so nice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Canned_heatit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location in downtown chicago. Room are fine, service is ok. The location is perfect, good price for this location

Reviews.Title: “Good price, nice location and clean”
Reviews.Author: MichellePs
Reviews.Content: Spur of the moment trip to go see Oprah! The price was right, including parking and they allowed us a late check out. The room was small, but clean and was all we needed for this trip. The room was updated with a microwave and refrigerator. We were not fans of the bed...because of that, would most likely try someplace new next time.

Reviews.Title: “Love HGI. Love this location.”
Reviews.Author: IRGPT
Reviews.Content: One of my preferred stays in Chicago. I have stayed here before but this is my first review. Rooms - About what you would expect from HGI. Very comfortable. I had a decent size room with adequate space. All the regular HGI amenities. Staff - The front desk staff is great. Very helpful. I also like the ability to text my info to the valet to have the car brought around. By the time I got to the lobby and checked out my car was ready. Hotel - Small lobby. Hotel has a direct entrance to the Weber Grill which is open late. Great restaurant. Location - The location is fantastic. You can catch the Red Line just steps from the hotel. Michigan Avenue is just a couple of blocks to the east. There are a ton of restaurants and shopping within a very short walk. You're about four blocks north of the river. One thing to note though - the website makes it sound like you're just a few blocks from Navy Pier. That's a little bit of a stretch. If you want to be close to Navy Pier or if you want to be in close walking distance to Millinneum Park/museum/planetarium/lakefront, you'll probably want to look at someplace closer. But as far as being in the thick of downtown this is a great option for the price. Value - I opted for the parking package. The overall room rate plus parking was great for downtown Chicago. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, good value.”
Reviews.Author: cavanburen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over Valentine's weekend. The rooms and overall hotel condition is very nice and very clean. This is a very good location as many stores and restaurants are well within walking distance. There were really only two negatives that we could draw from our stay, but neither affected our overall satisfaction with the hotel. The first is that there is construction right outside of the hotel. This made it difficult to catch a cab and we never did have a doorman assist. The second is that it took way to long to have a valet help when arriving. As mentioned, neither took away from our overall stay. We would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay with our family”
Reviews.Author: DamonZ28
Reviews.Content: My wife, son, & I stayed here for New Year's eve this year. We really enjoyed our stay. The valet parking is nice (expensive, but ALL parking in Chicago is expensive), but make sure you have all your luggage out of the trunk before the valet takes off with your car! :) The hotel staff is very pleasant, and answered several questions I had about the hotel and the area. The Weber Grill restaurant on-site is excellent, the food and service are both great. We had a nice city view on the 13th floor. There are many places to go in the area, and the Magnificent Mile is just a few short blocks away. This hotel is a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip!”
Reviews.Author: advisin1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilten Garden for one night in Januray. The hotel was very clean and service was great! The front desk personnel was very friendly and helpful! The room, which was a suite on the top floor, room 2302, was very spacious and clean! The Weber Grill was convenient and served excellent food. The location of the hotel was top notch! The only complaints I would have would be the valet staff - when we first pulled up we waited over 5 minutes for the staff, who were standing around talking, to come over to the car. No one ever came over so finally my husband went to them. Was very odd and not a great start. Thankfully the front desk service was much better! Also the bed was WAY too soft! While the room was great, the bed was small, only a double, and was very soft. To the point where we would both roll to the center. It was a bit comical but did not make for a comfortable night sleep. Other than that it was a great stay and the location made it all worth while!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jsmu224
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in the Hilton Garden Inn and I was very impressed! Upon arrival, the valet was very courteous and professional in taking down my information and letting me know exactly what I need to do to retrieve my car at any point. During check-in, the front office manager working at the time named Mirsada was very helpful in checking us in. My credit card was initially declined but she told me not to worry and that she would take care of it. The bellhop handled our luggage and was very friendly and helpful in describing the room once we arrived. The room was very clean and cozy. The beds are absolutely amazing! The only negative thing I can say regarding the rooms is that they did not have my wife's favorite TV station Bravo.
